# 1. Summary

## Key highlights for decision-makers

- **Measles:** Suspected cases were reported in multiple provinces. Strengthen active case search, specimen referral, and rapid response in high-reporting areas.
- **Anthrax:** Suspected cases were concentrated in Southern Province, indicating continued zoonotic risk. Strengthen One Health coordination and laboratory confirmation.
- **Malaria:** Malaria remains the leading contributor to weekly morbidity. Prioritize hotspot districts and ensure commodity availability.

# 2. Immediately notifiable diseases and events

```{r}
cat(paste(narratives[1:4], collapse = "\n"))
```

## Interpretation and recommendations

Prompt verification and investigation of suspected cases is recommended, particularly where clustering is observed. Provinces should ensure timely reporting and adherence to standard case definitions.

## Interpretation and recommendations

Routine high burden conditions require sustained surveillance, health promotion, and facility readiness. Unusual increases should be investigated to rule out outbreaks.

# 4. Summary report: priority diseases, conditions and events

```{r}
library(flextable)
library(officer)

ft <- flextable(priority_table)

ft <- ft |>
  theme_vanilla() |>
  fontsize(size = 10, part = "all") |>
  bold(part = "header") |>
  bg(part = "header", bg = "#F39C34") |> 
  color(part = "header", color = "white") |>
  bg(j = 1, part = "body", bg = "#FCE5CD") |>
  align(align = "center", part = "all") |>
  align(j = 1, align = "left", part = "all") |>
  autofit()

ft

```
